channel.title: Classes on BIO 108 and 217
channel.description: Recent content in Classes on BIO 108 and 217

item.title: May 3 Class
item.description: We won’t be in our Friday classroom this week, because we’ll be at Jamaica Bay WR for our extended field-trip, but we will have a quiz on last week’s species. The quiz will be on paper without slides. You’ll get a printed image of each species and you’ll write the species name next to it. Let me know if you have any questions about this. (No new learning species this week.

item.title: Apr 26 Class
item.description: Learning species (for quiz next week) Eastern Wood-Pewee House Finch Scarlet Tanager Red-eyed Vireo Yellow-rumped Warbler American Redstart Common Yellowthroat Yellow Warbler See also Afternotes

item.title: Apr 19 Class
item.description: Learning species (for quiz next week) Ruby-throated Hummingbird Tree Swallow Barn Swallow Purple Martin Chimney Swift See also We looked at several of the pages from Earbirding’s “How to Visualize Sounds” series. Contributed, field recorded spectrograms at the Macaulay Library “A Brief History of Spectrograms” from the same site. (In class I mentioned the early Golden Guide uses.) Afternotes
